organization.description:
Weather, temperature, carbon, water, soil and all other kinds of climate related open data.  Including (but not limited to) data about:

 * the atmosphere
 * the weather
 * air quality
 * temperature
 * the ocean
 * rivers
 * water levels
 * water quality
 * carbon emissions
 * pollution
 * soil erosion
 * biodiversity

For background information see [blog on article on IPCC data](http://blog.okfn.org/2007/11/20/the-ipcc-data-distribution-centre-environmental-data-licensing/), [the wiki](http://wiki.okfn.org/OpenEnvironmentalData), and [this other blog article](http://blog.okfn.org/2009/12/05/climate-change-climate-sceptics-and-open-data/). If you would like to help update or maintain this group, please [get in touch](http://okfn.org/contact)!

The climate data group is supported by the [Open Knowledge Foundation](http://www.okfn.org), [Clear Climate Code](http://clearclimatecode.org/) and the scientists at [Real Climate](http://www.realclimate.org/).

### Existing Lists of Climate Datasets to Migrate Here

 * <http://www.realclimate.org/index.php/data-sources/>
 * <http://ergodd.zoo.ox.ac.uk/eden/index.php?p=10>
 * <http://wiki.okfn.org/OpenEnvironmentalData/DatabaseOfEmissionsData>
 * <http://wiki.okfn.org/OpenEnvironmentalData>
organization.title: Climate Data
organization.name: climatedata

name: millenium-ecosystem-assessment-data
notes:
### About

Data for the Millenium Ecosystem Assessment. From the website:

> Welcome to the World Data Center for Biodiversity and Ecology (WDCBE) collaborative web site project with the Millennium Ecosystem Assessment. Working in conjunction with partners at the  Millennium Ecosystem Assessment (MA),  United Nations Environment Program (UNEP), the  the Center for International Earth Science Information Network (CIESIN), the  UNEP- World Conservation Monitoring Centre (WCMC), and the  the National Biological Information Infrastructure (NBII). We are developing an interactive system that will allow easy access to reports, maps and the data collected during the Millennium Ecosystem Assessment global evaluation of ecosystems. The WDCBE is committed to providing the long-term support for a system that provides access to vital information on the world's ecosystems. Ultimately, the Millennium Ecosystem Assessment information on this site will form the baseline for future assessments of the earth's ecosystems by scientists, managers, policy-makers, educators, and the public.

### Openness

[Copyright](http://wdc.nbii.gov/ma/privacy.htm#Copyright) page says:

> WDCBE-authored or produced data and information are in the public domain. While the content of many WDCBE Web pages is in the public domain, some WDCBE pages contain material that is copyrighted by others and used by the WDCBE with permission. You may need to obtain permission from the copyright owner for other uses. Furthermore, some non-WDCBE data, products, and information linked, or referred to, from this site may be protected under U.S. and foreign copyright laws. You may need to obtain permission from the copyright owner to acquire, use, reproduce, or distribute these materials. It is the sole responsibility of you, the user of this site, to carefully examine the content of the WDCBE and all linked pages for copyright restrictions and to secure all necessary permissions.
title: Millenium Ecosystem Assessment Data
